The Belarus Democracy Reauthorization Act of 2006 highlights clear violations of democratic principles in Belarus, particularly in the flawed presidential and parliamentary elections of March 19, 2006. These violations undermine the legitimacy of executive and legislative authority in the country, as well as disregard basic rights of freedom of assembly, association, and expression.
